intro: Valerianella rubens, commonly known as red valerian, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has heart-shaped, hairy leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Valerianella rubens is known for its pleasant fragrance and is sometimes used in ornamental gardening.
